com.github.tommyettinger.colorful

Class ColorfulSprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion
      • com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.ColorfulSprite

  • public class ColorfulSprite
extends com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion
    Holds the geometry, color, and texture information for drawing 2D sprites using ColorfulBatch. A ColorfulSprite has a position and a size given as width and height. The position is relative to the origin of the coordinate system specified via ColorfulBatch.begin() and the respective matrices. A ColorfulSprite is always rectangular and its position (x, y) are located in the bottom left corner of that rectangle. A ColorfulSprite also has an origin around which rotations and scaling are performed (that is, the origin is not modified by rotation and scaling). The origin is given relative to the bottom left corner of the ColorfulSprite, its position.

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • ColorfulSprite

        public ColorfulSprite()
        Creates an uninitialized sprite. The sprite will need a texture region and bounds set before it can be drawn.

      • ColorfulSprite

        public ColorfulSprite(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture texture)
        Creates a sprite with width, height, and texture region equal to the size of the texture.
        Parameters:
        texture - A Texture that will be used in full for this ColorfulSprite.

      • ColorfulSprite

        public ColorfulSprite(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture texture,
                      int srcWidth,
                      int srcHeight)
        Creates a sprite with width, height, and texture region equal to the specified size. The texture region's upper left corner will be 0,0.
        Parameters:
        texture - A Texture that will have some of its area used for this ColorfulSprite, starting at 0,0 in the upper left.
        srcWidth - The width of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
        srcHeight - The height of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.

      • ColorfulSprite

        public ColorfulSprite(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture texture,
                      int srcX,
                      int srcY,
                      int srcWidth,
                      int srcHeight)
        Creates a sprite with width, height, and texture region equal to the specified size.
        Parameters:
        texture - A Texture that will have some of its area used for this ColorfulSprite, starting at srcX,srcY in the upper left.
        srcX - The x-coordinate for the upper left corner of the region to use.
        srcY - The y-coordinate for the upper left corner of the region to use.
        srcWidth - The width of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
        srcHeight - The height of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.

      • ColorfulSprite

        public ColorfulSprite(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion region)
        Creates a sprite based on a specific TextureRegion, the new sprite's region is a copy of the parameter region - altering one does not affect the other
        Parameters:
        region - A TextureRegion that will have relevant data copied into this ColorfulSprite.

      • ColorfulSprite

        public ColorfulSprite(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion region,
                      int srcX,
                      int srcY,
                      int srcWidth,
                      int srcHeight)
        Creates a sprite with width, height, and texture region equal to the specified size, relative to specified sprite's texture region.
        Parameters:
        region - A TextureRegion that this will use for its Texture and as a basis for the relative coordinates in that Texture.
        srcX - Number of pixels to add to the texture coordinates of region on the x-axis.
        srcY - Number of pixels to add to the texture coordinates of region on the y-axis.
        srcWidth - The width of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
        srcHeight - The height of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.

      • ColorfulSprite

        public ColorfulSprite(ColorfulSprite colorfulSprite)
        Creates a colorfulSprite that is a copy in every way of the specified colorfulSprite.
        Parameters:
        colorfulSprite - A ColorfulSprite that will be copied exactly.

      • set

      • setBounds

        public void setBounds(float x,
                      float y,
                      float width,
                      float height)
        Sets the position and size of the sprite when drawn, before scaling and rotation are applied. If origin, rotation, or scale are changed, it is slightly more efficient to set the bounds after those operations.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
        y - The y-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
        width - The width to display the ColorfulSprite with.
        height - The height to display the ColorfulSprite with.

      • setSize

        public void setSize(float width,
                    float height)
        Sets the size of the sprite when drawn, before scaling and rotation are applied. If origin, rotation, or scale are changed, it is slightly more efficient to set the size after those operations. If both position and size are to be changed, it is better to use setBounds(float, float, float, float).
        Parameters:
        width - The width to display the ColorfulSprite with.
        height - The height to display the ColorfulSprite with.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(float x,
                        float y)
        Sets the position where the sprite will be drawn. If origin, rotation, or scale are changed, it is slightly more efficient to set the position after those operations. If both position and size are to be changed, it is better to use setBounds(float, float, float, float).
        Parameters:
        x - The x-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
        y - The y-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.

      • setOriginBasedPosition

        public void setOriginBasedPosition(float x,
                                   float y)
        Sets the position where the sprite will be drawn, relative to its current origin.
        Parameters:
        x - The adjustment to make to the x-position, relative to the current origin.
        y - The adjustment to make to the y-position, relative to the current origin.

        Parameters:
        x - The x-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.

        Parameters:
        y - The y-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.

      • translateX

        public void translateX(float xAmount)
        Sets the x position relative to the current position where the sprite will be drawn. If origin, rotation, or scale are changed, it is slightly more efficient to translate after those operations.
        Parameters:
        xAmount - How much to move the ColorfulSprite on the x-axis, in world space.

      • translateY

        public void translateY(float yAmount)
        Sets the y position relative to the current position where the sprite will be drawn. If origin, rotation, or scale are changed, it is slightly more efficient to translate after those operations.
        Parameters:
        yAmount - How much to move the ColorfulSprite on the y-axis, in world space.

      • translate

        public void translate(float xAmount,
                      float yAmount)
        Sets the position relative to the current position where the sprite will be drawn. If origin, rotation, or scale are changed, it is slightly more efficient to translate after those operations.
        Parameters:
        xAmount - How much to move the ColorfulSprite on the x-axis, in world space.
        yAmount - How much to move the ColorfulSprite on the y-axis, in world space.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(float color)
        Sets the color used to tint this sprite. Default is Palette.GRAY, which makes no changes to the color. Use FloatColors.floatColor(float, float, float, float) or a predefined color from Palette if you don't have a color currently.
        Parameters:
        color - the packed float color used to add luma, warmth, and mildness to the current sprite, as well as the multiplier for alpha

      • setTweakedColor

        public void setTweakedColor(float color,
                            float tweak)
        Sets the color used to tint this sprite and the tweak that affects how that color will be treated. Default color is Palette.GRAY, which makes no changes to the color, and default tweak is ColorfulBatch.TWEAK_RESET, which resets any changes to the tweak back to a neutral state. You can easily get a tweak value with FloatColors.floatColor(float, float, float, float), just using the last parameter to represent contrast.
        Parameters:
        color - the packed float color used to add luma, warmth, and mildness to the current sprite, as well as the multiplier for alpha
        tweak - the packed float used to multiply luma, warmth and mildness, as well as the setting for contrast

      • setTweak

        public void setTweak(float tweak)
        Sets the tweak that affects how the rendered color will be treated. Default tweak is ColorfulBatch.TWEAK_RESET, which resets any changes to the tweak back to a neutral state. You can easily get a tweak value with FloatColors.floatColor(float, float, float, float), just using the last parameter to represent contrast.
        Parameters:
        tweak - the packed float used to multiply luma, warmth and mildness, as well as the setting for contrast

      • setColor

        public void setColor(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color color)
        Given an RGBA8888 Color from libGDX, this converts that to a YCwCmA color as a packed float and sets the color of the sprite using that.
        Parameters:
        color - a libGDX RGBA8888 Color

      • setOriginCenter

        public void setOriginCenter()
        Place origin in the center of the sprite

      • setRotation

        public void setRotation(float degrees)
        Sets the rotation of the sprite in degrees. Rotation is centered on the origin set in setOrigin(float, float)

      • getRotation

        public float getRotation()
        Returns:
        the rotation of the sprite in degrees

      • rotate

        public void rotate(float degrees)
        Sets the sprite's rotation in degrees relative to the current rotation. Rotation is centered on the origin set in setOrigin(float, float)

      • rotate90

        public void rotate90(boolean clockwise)
        Rotates this sprite 90 degrees in-place by rotating the texture coordinates. This rotation is unaffected by setRotation(float) and rotate(float).

      • setScale

        public void setScale(float scaleXY)
        Sets the sprite's scale for both X and Y uniformly. The sprite scales out from the origin. This will not affect the values returned by getWidth() and getHeight()

      • setScale

        public void setScale(float scaleX,
                     float scaleY)
        Sets the sprite's scale for both X and Y. The sprite scales out from the origin. This will not affect the values returned by getWidth() and getHeight()

      • scale

        public void scale(float amount)
        Sets the sprite's scale relative to the current scale. for example: original scale 2 sprite.scale(4) final scale 6. The sprite scales out from the origin. This will not affect the values returned by getWidth() and getHeight()

      • getVertices

        public float[] getVertices()
        Returns the packed vertices, colors, and texture coordinates for this sprite.

      • getBoundingRectangle

        public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle getBoundingRectangle()
        Returns the bounding axis aligned Rectangle that bounds this sprite. The rectangles x and y coordinates describe its bottom left corner. If you change the position or size of the sprite, you have to fetch the triangle again for it to be recomputed.
        Returns:
        the bounding Rectangle

      • getColor

        public float getColor()
        Returns the color of this sprite. If the returned instance is manipulated, setColor(float) must be called afterward.
        Returns:
        a packed float color that stores luma addend, warmth addend, mildness addend, and alpha multiplier

      • getColorTweak

        public float getColorTweak()
        Returns the multiplicative color tweaks used by this sprite, as a packed float with the same format as a color.
        Returns:
        a packed float that stores luma multiplier, warmth multiplier, mildness multiplier, and contrast
